FSW.content: Nachtrag (postscript, appendix, codicil) > present is only a call for a footnote

O.content: what if Hegelian text was a simulacrum, yielding undecidable signs of its pretence only in sub-text? Feuerbach wants to reclaim gravity of everything Hegel relegates to footnotes, everything that is against philosophy, that resists abstract thought

TR.content: is not every footnote a little Oedipal? a symptomatic swelling, a swollen foot (hindering text’s step-by-step advance)?
basted effect of certain footnotes, animal-machines camouflaged in shadows (prudently left in corners)—threatening security of a space & a logic
footnotes show what must not be said > Schelling: “[footnotes] should remain hidden”
